bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Aristides Agramonte, January 26, 1911

div1.p: Kean requests Agramonte's photograph for a publication about the Yellow Fever Commission. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Aristides Agramonte, January 26, 1911
div1.opener:
CARDED
OFFICE OF SURGEON GENERAL,
JAN 26
38657.
10
1911
WAR DEPARTMENT.
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON.
January 26, 1911
Dr. Aristides Agramonte,
Profesor, Universidad de la Habana,
K Street, Vedado, Habana, Cuba.
My dear Doctor Agramonte:
div1.p:
There is a constant demand for information about the work of
the Yellow Fever Commission and the Surgeon General to meet it has
gotten together the various publications of the Commission and Dr. Carroll
and some other material bearing on the subject which he will ask to have
published as a Senate Document.

We would like the pictures of the various members of the Commission
to go into this publication and, therefore, I will ask you to please send
me your photograph as promptly as may be convenient. It should be cabinet
size and preferably unmounted, but rolled in a mailing tube or packed in
some other way so as not to get broken.

With reference to the substance of your last letter, Dr. Guiteras
published in the Army and Navy Journal a very satisfactory and complete
reply to the objectionable paragraph of last October, which makes I think
a very creditable showing for the sanitary department.
With best wishes for your health and prosperity, I remain,
div1.closer: Yours very sincerely, J.R. Kean Lt. Colonel, Medical Corps, U.S. Army.
